taskBoard

Class Option

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskBoard.Option

  • public class Option
extends java.lang.Object
    The Options class is the core part for verifying user input command line, by calling the method check()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Option

        public Option(java.lang.String[] args,
              Prefix prefix,
              Multiplicity multiplicity,
              int minData,
              int maxData)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        args - The user input command line
        prefix - The prefix character used in front of the option keyword, it will set for all the option keywords
        multiplicity - The multiplicity to use for an option
        minData - The minimum number of data items (items without prefix)
        maxData - The maximum number of data items (items without prefix)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either args, prefix, multiplicity, minData or maxData is invalid

      • Option

        public Option(java.lang.String[] args,
              int minData,
              int maxData)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        args - The user input command line
        minData - The minimum number of data items (items without prefix)
        maxData - The maximum number of data items (items without prefix)

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either args, minData or maxData is invalid

    • Method Detail

      • addSet

        public OptionSet addSet(java.lang.String setName,
                        int minDataValue,
                        int maxDataValue,
                        java.lang.String setDescription)
        Add an option set
        Parameters:
        setName - the name for this set, and must be a unique identifier
        minDataValue - the minimum number of data items (items without prefix) for this set
        maxDataValue - the maximum number of data items (items without prefix) for this set
        setDescription - the description of this option set
        Returns:
        The new OptionSet instance created. This is useful to allow chaining of addOption() calls right after this method

      • addSet

        public OptionSet addSet(java.lang.String setName,
                        java.lang.String setDescription)
        Add an option set
        Parameters:
        setName - The name for this set, and must be a unique identifier
        setDescription - The description for this option set
        Returns:
        The new OptionSet instance created. This is useful to allow chaining of addOption() calls right after this method

      • getSet

        public OptionSet getSet(java.lang.String setName)
        Get an option set based on the given set name
        Parameters:
        setName - The name of the set needed
        Returns:
        the retrieved option set

      • getNumberOfOptionSets

        public int getNumberOfOptionSets()
        Get the number of option sets added in an Options instance
        Returns:
        The retrieved number

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSetName()

        Returns:

        public java.lang.String getErrorInformation()
        Get the error message after calling check() method
        Returns:

      • check

        public boolean check(java.lang.String setName)
        Check the user input command line against a given set
        Parameters:
        setName - The name of the option set needs to be checked
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating the checking result
